pageContext.claim: “[Biden] opposed the mission to take out Osama bin Laden.”
pageContext.analysis: Biden, in front of other aides, clearly said more time was needed to confirm al-Qaeda leader Osama bin Laden had been located, according to various accounts. But there is no evidence Biden was opposed to “taking out” bin Laden. There is a difference between saying “don't go now” and “being opposed to taking out bin Laden.” In the Situation Room, there is little dispute Biden urged caution about the intelligence and suggested taking time to get more information. Even in Biden’s original telling, he said: “My suggestion is, don't go. We have to do two more things to see if he’s there.” Biden’s later efforts to say he privately advised Obama to go remain unconfirmed. (We looked at this issue in detail in this report).
